website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy steel step with easy fold-out lockable legs. Features a durable non-slip rubber platform cover and rubber feet for extra grip.
pros: Steel step stool with a weight capacity of up to 330 pounds
Maximum height of 6.8 inches with easy fold-out legs that lock into place
Lightweight at 4 pounds, and easy to fold down for storing away
Non-slip rubber platform and rubber feet for extra grip
cons: Some users find it not tall enough for their needs

customer_reviews.title: Step Up Stool
customer_reviews.text: I'm a senior with a bad hip and do step-up exercises as part of program prescribed by my physical therapist. I am 6'3" and weigh 290 and this piece of equipment supports me with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Woyaya

customer_reviews.title: Small but STURDY
customer_reviews.text: This thing isn't going anywhere when you're standing on it. Strong and secure. I am not a slender lady; it does not protest under my weight. I would wish it were maybe two inches taller, but then I don't know if it could still be so strong. For most things where I need a step stool though, this is enough height. And those non-skid feet are REALLY non-skid! You'll feel safe on it.
customer_reviews.author: Helen White Noble

customer_reviews.title: large step surface with ribbed vinyl & folding sturdy legs
customer_reviews.text: We now have two of these folding legs stools for 3 year old grandchild to use in the bathroom and in the car to assist climbing into the car seat. Sturdy with a large ribbed vinyl top surface and with easily folded legs to put away when not needed. It has a carrying handle and the child can locate it and set it up when they come to visit. The previous bathroom steps were a second-hand plastic stool that was wide enough and tall enough but didn't have any gripper feet to keep it in place like this one.
customer_reviews.author: DC Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect extra step for our Roadtrek RV. Didn't realize it was foldable and had a carrying strap. Nice extras. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Armstrong - Northwoods Bookshop

customer_reviews.title: Secure and large step
customer_reviews.text: Serves exactly my needs. Disabled user feels more secure with the large size step, sturdy legs. Just the right amount of height for her to get both feet on step to safely manuver into tall truck. FINALLY! I like the easy fold with lock pins.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little step to give me that extra height to my upper cabinets.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a step that I could hide away in my kitchen. This step folds up to about 2 inches. It's sturdy. I'm 220 lbs. This adds a little over 6 inches of height.
customer_reviews.author: D. Curran

customer_reviews.title: I love this step I use it for my van when ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this step I use it for my van when I take my mother to doctors visits or shopping and visiting relatives. it is very sturdy and compact. I love that it is metal and foldable I can slide it under a seat or just put it in the back of my van. I have used it to see if it can hold up to my weight and I was at 245 at the the time that I purchased it and I had no issues with it . I felt like it was very strong and sturdy not like a plastic one that you feel like it wobbles or is going to crack or collapse.
customer_reviews.author: Sensei Torres CKF

customer_reviews.title: This is a smaller step. Great for portability.
customer_reviews.text: This is a small sturdy short step. It is a bit smaller than I realized, given our intended goal, but I think I will be able to make it work. I bought it so my dog could get into the car easier, given she is getting older and is having trouble with her hind end. The step is small, which makes it harder to train her that she should use it to walk on. (She isn't allowed on the furniture, and has been discouraged to learn to climb onto things in an effort to keep her from getting out, which has worked well for us until now.)
customer_reviews.author: Mistress Collette

customer_reviews.title: Very unstable
customer_reviews.text: One of the bolts on the leg was missing and it collapsed when my elderly mother stood on it. She would’ve been injured if I hadn’t been standing there. I had to go to the hardware store to buy the hardware to fix it. I would never buy this again. Even after I fixed it it’s very wobbly
customer_reviews.author: noreen meeker

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and reliable!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stool. I direct a choir that sings in a multi-purpose hall weekly without risers or a director's podium. I'm only 5'3" and was having trouble with visibility. So I was looking for something that I could carry in the trunk of my car and bring in and out with no trouble. This stool does the trick. I like how easy it is to open and close, and the handle is great too. I stand on it while waving my arms for minutes at a time, feet shoulder width apart, and never have any balance issues. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: dlt

customer_reviews.title: Great and strong step
customer_reviews.text: Works great, holds my fathers weight and is the correct height for getting into my truck. It is constructed very well and the legs fold in for compactness and storage.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Lewinski

customer_reviews.title: defective
customer_reviews.text: Product seems like it would work for my needs but one of the legs would NOT lock in place. As such, unsafe to use and sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick McGhie

customer_reviews.title: It’s perfect!
customer_reviews.text: After doing lots of research to find the perfect stool, I ordered this item and have no regrets! It’s the right size and height and is very sturdy and stable. The best feature is that it easily folds flat and has a carrying handle. It’s great for a place with limited space.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannette G

customer_reviews.title: We leave it open
customer_reviews.text: because opening the legs was hard on both my hands and my mom's [impossible for her really]. That said, this has made a HUGE difference for us in getting her in and out of my car [Toyota highlander] - she keeps it in a tote bag and hangs it off her walker when I pick her up - then I lay it on the ground in position, get her settled in the seat and put it back in the car - very sturdy and stable - whew!
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Rubber felt like a plastic to me.
customer_reviews.text: The top rubber platform and feet felt slippery. Like a plastic. The specs said it was rubber and if so was not a rubber like a road tire like I would expect. On my hardwood floor the stool would easily slide so not a safe idea to keep this item for a step stool waiting for an accident to happen with. Also the top rubber was peeling from the base of the stool and I hadn't even used it. Sending back and dissappointed because it felt like a sturdy piece and I liked the folding legs and the fact that it was portable like that.
customer_reviews.author: LesBooks

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Ok. I will tell the whole story. My wife got one of those cheap plastic folding stepping stools it says it rated for 300 lbs ... they lie. My not so light 260 lbs frame stepped on it to put up window film ... it fell apart like a house of cards. So, I purchased as a replacement. I will tell you now my 260 lbs frame felt safe and secure on this stepping stool.
customer_reviews.author: Duc Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Works but seems a little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: It works but wouldn't trust it with too much weight. lightweight easy to stow. I was right it didn't last, Leg bent after maybe using it about 50 times. I weigh 180 so why? Avoid this cheap metal junk.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Gorski

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Using on older RV that had one step down in rear bumper and nothing else, so its much easier getting in and out now. After using for a few weeks, the top is denting from where feet are stepping on in and out, due to soft ground used a 3/4" real plywood for a base so feet would not sink in, and rubber foot on one leg slid, I fell, leg is now bent, cheap awful product, want to return don't see that option. DO NOT BUY THIS CHEAP PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: bought it

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, compact: recommended for RV
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, compact and exactly fit my purpose. I'm a short person (5'2") and in my Airstream trailer, I can't see into the bottom of the the top cabinets, which of course have a bottom lip. I also can't comfortably touch the ground sitting in a camp chair (the more upright directors-style type). The relatively short height of this step stool solves both of my problems! It is high enough to see into the cabinets and low enough to be a comfortable foot stool while lounging outside. And it is easy to store in a small space.
customer_reviews.author: Nonie G Ravenberg

customer_reviews.title: So lightweight, flat and portable but STURDY!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to keep near my stacked washer and dryer. I am so short I can't always get the clothes from the back of the dryer, or see the top controls. Such a neat little piece of equipment I also bought one to keep in my car - sometimes you just need those few extra inches! It is so flat and lightweight you can store it anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: HSHOBX

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: This is so low to the ground that it does not allow you to be able to reach anything. I have a really big step, and a ladder. I was looking for a small step to keep out so that I didn’t have to grab the large one to reach stuff in my kitchen cabinet. I am 5”2, I feel like I am only 5”6 on this. I didn’t measure it, but I think you get my point. This is not helpful at all.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy portable step.
customer_reviews.text: Useful and well built step. Folds easily into a compact shape and stores anywhere. Nice and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.text: Multiple uses. Folds up so it's easy to carry and to store. This is my go to item when I need a little height.
customer_reviews.author: Sallie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I work in the NEMT industry. I love these stepstools for our dodge caravans. They fold up nicely to fit in the netting behind the driver's backseat. They are very heavy duty and non-slip. Also, they are the perfect height for an elderly or disabled client who needs just a bit of a step to get into a higher vehicle. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lochner

customer_reviews.title: Functional, sturdy, and easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. Just the right height for stepping into and out of my tall-sided slipper tub.
customer_reviews.author: Appellatia

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but with a big caveat.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this portable step stool to use with my band when walking up and down larger stages. It's sturdy, but I have a huge issue with retracting the legs after each use. I ended up finally just leaving the legs out, thus increasing my loadup footprint. It's very, very, very difficult to pop out the little ball on each extended leg to fold up into the base. I ended up having to use a screwdriver for leverage and even then, one leg is stubborn. I just gave up after awhile. It works, but if you're looking for something portable, it's not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: GuitarRebel

customer_reviews.title: Functions Without Issue After Months of Daily Use
customer_reviews.text: Update: I purchased this stool in June of 2019 and it's now March of 2020. After 9 months of consistent use, I haven't had any issues with stability, loosening parts, or damage in that time. For reference, I'm 5' 2", weigh 220 lb, and frequently use this to reach items around the house or refill the bird feeder hanging over the patio. It also gets daily use as a support stool in the bathroom (high toilet seat). Storage is simple due to the folding legs and there is a handle to easily carry it where needed. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: EverNai

customer_reviews.title: Light and thin
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a stepstool I could put in the space between the seats of my pickup, so we could get up into it easier. This fit the bill extremely well. And, with the feet angled beyond the edges of the platform; it doesn't tip when you step on it. Great! It just took a little effort to understand how to fold and unfold it properly.
customer_reviews.author: Fauna Sonden

customer_reviews.title: I like the stool
customer_reviews.text: I like the stool, but the steel legs have cut through the rubber feet after a few days. Disappointing. They've filled with dirt. Not sure what I'll do, but would have hoped for a sturdier rubber footing.
customer_reviews.author: kc1tom

customer_reviews.title: It is VERY sturdy as well
customer_reviews.text: This has been such a help for my sister who has mobility issues. She can now get in an out of her car independently. Because it has a handle on the side we were able to attach a cord to it so she can haul it into the car once she has stepped inside. It is VERY sturdy as well. What a difference it has made to her life!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The stepper was sturdy and Very compact as the legs collapes
customer_reviews.text: The product worked well. The step stool was helpful with my Mother due to I have a high JEEP Wrangler and the step stool was extremely helpful and sturdy in assisting my Mother. I absolutely recommend this product. I love the idea that the legs collapses and there is a side carrying handle . I slide it under the back seat.
customer_reviews.author: RMG

customer_reviews.title: I carry it in my car for rooftop access!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 70 year old, 5'3" woman who likes to go out kayaking. This delightful little stool is carried in my car so that I can load up and take down the kayak from on top of my SUV. The stool provides just the right amount of height so that I can reach. The stool is easy to open and close, and it is very stable when in use. Because it folds, it is kept under the seat, where it takes little space. Very convenient!
customer_reviews.author: walkingnow

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy stool. If you need just a step up this is a good one to have. A little pricey in my opinion, but it is a nice stool.
customer_reviews.author: A Friend

customer_reviews.title: Not Slip resistant and very dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: Although this product was well built I was disappointed with the fact it was covered in a hard plastic that was not nonslip and even worse each leg had a pointed plastic cap which made it very slippery on wood and tile surfaces and very, very dangerous. I returned the product and cannot recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert allen

customer_reviews.title: it's very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I needed something wide so my lamp base could fit under it and this fit the bill. However, it is very easy to unfold and locks in place. I have had no problems
customer_reviews.author: T. Paddy

customer_reviews.title: I love my folding stool
customer_reviews.text: I was horrified when I went to lunch with my Sister and Brother-in-Law at the beginning of December and needed his help to get in and out of her jeep because of my arthritis. I got that folding stool right away and when they picked me up again in the Jeep Christmas Eve I got in and out easily without any help. I love my stool and keep it tucked away in my car so it's right there if anyone picks me up in a vehicle I can't get into easily enough.
customer_reviews.author: A. Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Step up!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I had a very steep RV lot that wasn't level at all. I'm short so I needed help up and my dog was having trouble as well. After getting it, i love it. I had to teach my dog to not be afraid of it and use it to step up. She did and now we use it even tho my current RV pad is concrete and level! Cuz it makes the step up easier!
customer_reviews.author: rdumas13

customer_reviews.title: Not quality metal
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money . I bought as I am pregnant and need a step up into the bed. It broke in a month. I’m not that heavy sheesh.
customer_reviews.author: Chunshine

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and good height.
customer_reviews.text: Stepstool is the perfect height to use as starter step for travel trainer. Holds me easily, at 225 lbs. Folds easily, legs lock into open position, and has a non- slip surface to stand on. Same versions are 65$ in rv stores.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Slippery. Unsafe.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the slipperiest step stools. It is non skid on top where tour feet go, but the leg grips are made of hard plastic which has no grip. It slid out from under me and slides when my kids get on and off. I tried on two types of tile, hardwood.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and compact
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little step to get into our travel trailer ! It's the right height to our first step on the trailer and very sturdy when all legs are locked in. My only concern is that water pools under the mat on top so you have to turn it upside down and shake the water out after a rain if the awning isn't out. Other than that it holds a lot of weight and folds up compactly when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Gaffney

customer_reviews.title: Small, but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy for its smallish footprint! The only thing I don't like is that rain puddles collect on top. The folding mechanism is nicely done.
customer_reviews.author: Pogo's MomTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Excellent step stool!
customer_reviews.text: I am 258lbs so I needed something that would accommodate my girth. This step stool is great. Took my weight with no problem. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sharlene R. Head

customer_reviews.title: Works great for RV
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a heavy pallet like "step" that was in an RV I purchased used. The previous owners used a heavy wood structure that looked similar to a pallet as an extra step to make getting into the RV easier. The weight and space it was taking up in the storage compartment just didn't make sense for its purpose, so I tried this little step. This worked perfectly! It is light weight and when folded, takes almost no room. It flexes a little bit under adult weight but not enough to be concerned about. If you need just a little extra step somewhere in your life, I would recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Love this stool! Use it with our RV.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use with our motorhome, where the built-in first step up was kind of a doozy. This is perfect! It's super sturdy, stays in place, no fear of it tipping over it you don't step on it exactly the right way. We love it. It's a little stiff to fold up, but we really don't bother folding it. We just set it inside the door when we're on the road, and it's ready to go when we stop.
customer_reviews.author: Mntnstorm

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad stool for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stool because I had my shoulder replaced and I have a high bed to climb into. So, I needed something to help give me "a little lift" so that I wouldn't have to put any pressure on my right arm getting into bed. It did the trick! Since then, I've used it to reach a few things that are high up on shelves, etc. It can have a wee bit of a shake to it, but nothing that would keep me from using it. I'm on the heavier side and that's why I wanted a stool that would be stable for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lush Life

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and nice to stow away since the legs fold ...
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and nice to stow away since the legs fold down flat. It was nice to use for eldery family members to step up into our mini van. The height was a good height where it isn’t too hard for older folks to step up.
customer_reviews.author: ATX family

customer_reviews.title: Satified & pleased customer
customer_reviews.text: Wife just had a knee replacement & needed help getting in our 4wd pickup. She weighs in excess of 200#'s. This step-up is just what we needed. The step-surface is good sized and the height is almost exactly half of the step bar height. I can see this being used even after the current need & the quality says it will last for this need - very sturdy. Delivery was standard for Amazon - quick and faultless. We highly recommend this purchase from Amazon for quality and price!
customer_reviews.author: B. R. W.

customer_reviews.title: Ollieroo Step Stool
customer_reviews.text: Perfect step stool for my wife. Our new bed is high and she had trouble getting into bed because she is 5’1” lol. With the step stool no more issues. Easy assembly and it fits under bed when not needed.
customer_reviews.author: David Valentín

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and effective
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect height.. especially for the elderly or children who can't take a big step up but need a little assist getting into bed. sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: sandy b

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy! A real lifesaver.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this step stool to help my elderly parents to get in and out of our SUV. It is so sturdy that my parents are not nervous to use it and it’s a lifesaver because they are small and we were worried they could fall. It folds up neatly and we keep it in the trunk of our car. Highly recommend. We could not be happier with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Markela S.

customer_reviews.title: very helpful
customer_reviews.text: We bought this item to help elder family members get in and out of our truck. Very sturdy and worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: hornet321

customer_reviews.title: Good quality stool
customer_reviews.text: Love this stool! Bought to use to reach into my new washing machine as I am only 5 feet tall. Legs fold in and out easily to store flat.
customer_reviews.author: SherI Delguidice

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.  Not flimsy at all.
customer_reviews.text: This was just the stool I needed to reach into my new speed oven which is a few inches too high. It is very sturdy and compact when folded so it easily stored in a shallow drawer under the wall oven. Glad I found it.
customer_reviews.author: B H

customer_reviews.title: Solid feel and portable too
customer_reviews.text: Love the folding design. Very sturdy as a foot rest or for placing heavy objects off the ground. Metal and plastic are good materials that make it feel like quality product.
customer_reviews.author: OasisDweller

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT. A LITTLE PRICEY BUT WELL WORTH IT
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT. A LITTLE PRICEY BUT WELL WORTH IT. HAS RUBBER RIDGED TOP TO PREVENT SLIDING OFF. CAN SUSTAIN A GOOD WEIGHT AND DOESN'T COLLAPSE. IT FOLDS UP EASILY AND STORES IN A SKINNY SPACE. HAS AMPLE TOP AREA FOR A PERSON WITH A LARGE SIZE SHOE NOT LIKE A SMALL STEPLADDER, GREAT FOR GETTING INTO THESE CARS THAT ARE DIFFICULT TO GET INTO BECAUSE THEY ARE SO HIGH UP.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ann Chema

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy & Stable
customer_reviews.text: This stool folds up to a very slim profile and has a carrying handle for convenience. The legs when unfolded have pins that lock them into place and keep them from folding up unexpectedly. It is somewhat light weight, but not as light weight as plastic would be - but that is one reason I purchased this stool, for it's sturdiness. I am very satisfied with the product and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Catazara

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love the height of the stool. Being handicapp, I can not lift my leg/foot to the height of a regular stool. I like the sturdiness because I don't continually knock it over when I don't lift my foot high enough. It's so easy to take it wherever it's needed. I just fold it up and carry it with the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useful little product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my rottweiler mix so he could get in my jeep. I would normally lift him up by the butt. I am still trying to get his front paws on the stool so he can jump up on his own, at 105lbs he is getting to heavy to lift. It will be perfect once he figures it out. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna

customer_reviews.title: GREAT STEPSTOOL
customer_reviews.text: This stepstool is really handy. It folds for convience and is strong enough for the 330 lb. Product is just what I needed to help my mother into our van and me into my top kitchen cupboards and then it just folds and is easily stored. Love it
customer_reviews.author: jan

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: Works for me. Easy to assemble and can fold away to slide in next to the fridge. Stability is good but I weigh 175lb and I think it is at it's capacity.
customer_reviews.author: J Vacanti

customer_reviews.title: stable, sturdy, and non-marking
customer_reviews.text: Works great. We use it to help my wife climb up onto a high bed. Then it slips under the bed for storage. No sign of the pads marking/staining on our laminate wood floor. Very stable. I tried to cause it to tip by standing on the edge, but could not tip it.
customer_reviews.author: CenVillager

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice
customer_reviews.text: After looking at so many, I chose this and am very happy with my choice. It gives me just the right amount of height, I feel safe on it and it folds into a small space.
customer_reviews.author: Helen GriffisTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: not rubber...but workable
customer_reviews.text: This product is nice, right size, large platform but the feet are not rubber. I wanted this to help me get into a higher bed in my travel trailer. To use, I put a rubber backed rug on the floor first, then set the stool on top. Works great! Problem of non rubberized feet solved.
customer_reviews.author: AC622

customer_reviews.title: China Import
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for about 2 weeks now already showing signs of wear on the rubber pad. Starting to buckle and working it's way loose.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: The fact that it folds up as needed for easy storage
customer_reviews.author: henry felix

customer_reviews.title: Could Be Better
customer_reviews.text: While this Ollieroo step stool is very stable a couple improvements are in order. The rubber feet have worn thru already and one of the leg hinge pins has fallen out. It has not been used enough for this to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Mike J

customer_reviews.title: holds my fat body
customer_reviews.text: wife bought this to reach upper cabinets, I have been using it to wash truck, has not broken under my 250 lbs yet,
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Poor Construction.  High price
customer_reviews.text: Used 1 day at camp and one of the c clips came off the bushing that holds the leg in place therefore rendering it useless . Poor Construction not worth the $$$$
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Eggleston

customer_reviews.title: Best stool ever
customer_reviews.text: Not the prettiest but does it's job well. I HATE that I cannot get into my bed without help. This little marvel keeps its feet stationary on my wood floor while I stand on it; then I can push off onto the bed with no problem. I cannot rate how it folds because it's always up and ready to do it's thing. I'm 5'5" tall. Who would have ever thought these doggone new beds would be made for long legged giants!
customer_reviews.author: DBL

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: This is a stable and well made step. I bought it for my wife who is 6 months pregnant. She is just a few inches too short to reach certain things as a result so the step has come in handy. The light weight and portability give her no extra strain, and the carry handle ensures that level of convenience. It also helps me reach the one or two things just out of my reach. I definitely prefer using it over my taller three step stool simply for ease of movement around the house it provides.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: A great sturdy stool
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grandson to reach the sink and wash his hands. This is super sturdy and will not tip. The rubber top is non slip too. It's pretty easy to fold but you do need both hands and a bit of effort. So happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Brino

customer_reviews.title: What I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. Something small that I could take with me when I travel. I have stayed at several hotels recently and they had very high beds. I’m short so it was difficult. So you see this will help with my problem. It is small enough to pack in my suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and not too high a step. Perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Sturdy, Well Built
customer_reviews.text: Good looking and very sturdy. Nothing fancy here, but well designed and perfect for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good stable step stool. It is exactly the right height for my needs. It's light weight and folds down for storage. And it happens to be very attractive as well! I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Folds up flat.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Wanted a stool to help getting into SUV. Very sturdy. Not plastic... folds up flat . Has a handle on side. So will put a rope thru to pull it up into car. Makes it so much easier and takes stress off knee getting into vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This gave me my inches back.
customer_reviews.text: Before back surgery, I was 5'6". Now I am 5'4" Doesn't sound like much but it keeps me from reaching things in my cupboards. This sturdy little step stool makes me feel tall again. Lol. I can reach things on the top shelves.
customer_reviews.author: Rosah

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my need.
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy, but a little difficult to get the legs up & down. Although, it may get easier in time with use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not tall enough
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use as a step stool around the house. It is NOT tall enough for my needs so I returned it. Pay attention to the measurements. It is not a true step stool. I think it would be perfect for an extra camper step but not for reaching shelves in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: DebL

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, handy, and tucks away flat when you're done with it.
customer_reviews.text: Solid step, easy to fold/unfold, overall great design. Leg's lock in place to avoid mishaps. Angle on the legs prevents tipping (I tried, couldn't tip it.) The feet work well on any surface. Loaded it to 250 without a creak.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Civello

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy; blows away in a light wind. Useless unless using as a toilet step for small children.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Munky

customer_reviews.title: Great little stool that is a life saver
customer_reviews.text: I love this little stool. It is very sturdy and compact. I have a SUV that is hard to get in and out for my passengers and they are comfortable using it. Also, I have a new mattress that is much higher than my previous. I keep this next to my bed to aid me
customer_reviews.author: Jeudepalme

customer_reviews.title: This stool  is awesome for an RV!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the steps to help with getting in and out of our RV because the last stop was two high. This step stool is very nice, slip resistant and sturdy and does the job and folds down to next to nothing for storage.
customer_reviews.author: csrspgsgal

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to reach what I need
customer_reviews.text: The best thing, is it's easy storage and how it fits anywhere. Very secure when opened, no worry about a collapse as some folding stools do when in use
customer_reviews.author: Carol M

customer_reviews.title: Weight concern
customer_reviews.text: We're told to be careful on standing in the center of the step up gave me concern as to how much weight is bad ....I use it for my Mom who's 94 lbs This shouldn't be an issue I hope Can you advise ?
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my RV!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed a light, sturdy and compact stool next to my bed, which is raised. This fits the bill perfectly. It is very stable, folds easily and quickly and stows in a small space. It is well made and will last.
customer_reviews.author: FlagMom

customer_reviews.title: Love this stool!  Should have gotten long time ago
customer_reviews.text: Love this step stool . Folding and is a breeze. It holds my excessive size with ease. I use it at work to help me climb in and out of my mail truck . I have bad knees and this really helps and I feel very safe on it. I will be buying another to use at home esp in kitchen where cabinets are so tall. Still has hours sturdy hard rubber feet so no with hard wood floors . Buy this stool !
customer_reviews.author: Amaxon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worked perfectly. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: We needed a step stool delivered quickly for an injured member of our family. This step stool worked perfectly to help her in and out of our minivan. It provided a good, stable platform. It was a good height.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Only 6” tall but solid Who makes a 6” tall step stool. And the feet have locking pegs so it is more annoying then useful
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Low stool has many uses
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help my dog get into the back seat of my car. He is able to put his hind feet on the stool for an extra boost. It works very well! Does not slip and the legs fold easily. Very useful.
customer_reviews.author: DeborahP

customer_reviews.title: Sturdier than plastic options.  Takes an extra moment to unfold.
customer_reviews.text: I have size 12.5 US shoes. The platform is a bit small for me. I love the varying handle and the sturdiness is great. The rubber on the feet could be a bit softer to better stick to hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J. Stahl

customer_reviews.title: Small and Compact
customer_reviews.text: I use this as an additional step into my camper and about the height of a home stair step. It is light, study, compact when closed, and easy to fold. I recommend this stool and would buy this as a gift for others.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, perfect
customer_reviews.text: It's ideal to step from a wheelchair onto the 6" high stool. A 4" high wasn't quite enough to get my bottom onto a car seat. The stool is sturdy, folding legs, lightweight and I feel very safe with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Used as a step-up for a really tall bed. I weigh over 200lbs, and it feels very sturdy. I haven't folded it up, as I only leave it setting next to my side of the bed, but it seems to be a pretty good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect choice
customer_reviews.text: Were enjoy our foot, or should I say step ladder to the max
customer_reviews.author: Eloise  Colbert,

customer_reviews.title: Useful and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great step for short or infirm people climbing into a van
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Burris

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful.
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is awesome! It has really helped me perform some basic tasks around the house. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: davidkonitzer

customer_reviews.title: very handy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little stool for vans and other step-up areas, We used it on a tour bus with over 50 travelers on the bus using it everyday and it held up very well. A must for traveling
customer_reviews.author: Nell

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and great product
customer_reviews.text: Use this for my mom to get into my truck. Very sturdy and does the job
customer_reviews.author: Bossman

product_meta.title: Ollieroo Step Stool Portable Lightweight Folding Steel Step Ladder with Non Skid Rubber Platform One Step 330-Pound Capacity
feature_bullets: Easy fold away and lock design. Opens and closes in seconds for convenient portability
Lightweight step weighs just 4 lbs, Easily carry it with you
Maximum Load 330 lbs European Commission EN14183 Approved. Sturdy construction holds up to 330 pounds, bottom reinforced with non-slip grips
Multi-purpose plastic platform with anti-slip grips, for adults and children.
